metadata.Title: CVE-2023-3995 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - high.
metadata.Description:
This CVE ID has been rejected or withdrawn by its CVE Numbering Authority because it is a duplicate of CVE-2023-4147. Kevin Rich discovered that the netfilter subsystem in the Linux kernel did not properly handle rule additions to bound chains in certain circumstances. A local attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3995` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-5-generic - 6.5.0-5.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-5-generic - 6.5.0-5.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-5-generic-64k - 6.5.0-5.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1005-aws - 6.5.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1004-azure - 6.5.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1004-gcp - 6.5.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-5-lowlatency - 6.5.0-5.5.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-5-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-5.5.1
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

notes.Note: rodrigo-zaiden> Google kCTF submission same fix commit as CVE-2023-4147, one or the other will likely be marked as duplicated.
